Georgia is a state in the southeastern United States. It was established in 1732, 
the last of the original Thirteen Colonies. Named after King George II of Great 
Britain, Georgia was the fourth state to ratify the United States Constitution, on 
January 2, 1788. ... It was the last state to be restored to the Union, on July 15, 
1870.
